Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The

following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

ALLEGATION:
Facility has not submitted records to MDHHS for permanent retention one year
following the final order of adoption as required. There are 2 records that have not
been submitted.
INVESTIGATION:
On 5/23/22 it was reported to DCWL that DHHS had not received two closed
adoption files that were due in 2021. Contact occurred with the complainant to
determine the names on the overdue files.
Chief Administrator
On 5/24/22 Chief Administrator (CA) was contacted and informed of the allegation.
On 5/30/22 a site visit occurred at the agency and CA was interviewed. CA reported
maintaining a spreadsheet of finalized adoptions with due dates for the file to be sent
to DHHS. CA reported she did not previously have DHHS sign when accepting the
file. However, they plan to implement this practice going forward. CA reported that
during the COVID-19 pandemic local DHHS offices were refusing to accept case
files, as staff were not working in the office. Therefore, the agency held on to several
files from 2019-2022.
CA provided the following information for the identified files:
2

 File one: The file was due to DHHS by November 2021. However, it was not
on the spreadsheet and therefore sent late. The file was sent to DHHS on
4/27/22.
 File two: The file was due to DHHS by December 2021. However, it was not
sent on time, as the agency planned to send it when the sibling’s adoptions
were completed. Unfortunately, those adoptions took longer than expected.
The file was sent to DHHS on 5/19/22.
On 6/8/22 CA provided a list of all adoption files due from 2020 to 2022. There were
ten files currently overdue. There were forty-two files that were sent late. In addition,
from 2017-2019, seven files were sent to DHHS late and eighteen files were
overdue but had not been sent yet.
APPLICABLE RULE
ADM 1030 Disposition of Records for MDHHS- Supervised Children
For both MDHHS and contracted adoption agency cases, the
local MDHHS office or contracted agency must retain all
adoption case records for one year after finalization of the
adoption. One year (between 12-13 months) past the adoption
finalization date, a contracted adoption agency must send the
original record to the local MDHHS office; copies must not be
maintained by the contracted adoption agency; see licensing
rule R400.12713-Adoption Placement Record.
ANALYSIS: A violation was found due to multiple adoption files that were
late or remain overdue to DHHS.
Technical Assistance
It was discussed with the CA there was some confusion about
file retention dates and inclusion of the foster care file, when
sending the adoption file to DHHS. Technical Assistance was
provided regarding FOM 722-15 as it conflicts with Rule 422(4)
regarding file retention. DCWL confirmed that FOM 722-15 must
be followed.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
